title: Level 5: Twin Primes
description:
Twin primes are pairs of prime numbers that differ by exactly 2. For example: (3, 5), (5, 7), (11, 13), (17, 19).

Given this range: {{input}}

How many twin prime pairs exist where BOTH primes are within this range (inclusive)?

Note: Count pairs, not individual primes. For example, (3, 5), (5, 7), (11, 13) would be 3 pairs.
placeholder: Enter the number of twin prime pairs
hint: Generate all primes in the range first. Then check consecutive primes to see if they differ by exactly 2. Be careful: (3,5) and (5,7) are different pairs even though they share the number 5.
